introduction.title: The Crow Queen
introduction.tagline: All land bends. All flesh kneels.
introduction.description: Once the absolute ruler of Monstru, the Crow Queen—now called the Regent Black—was deposed by a monster uprising. Stripped of her throne but not her will, she fled with her Inner Court into exile. In Coffin Canyon, she has found not refuge, but opportunity. Here, she consecrates land, enslaves monsters, and grinds manlings beneath the weight of returning dominion.
introduction.philosophy: Order is not negotiated. It is imposed. Monsters are tools, humans are cattle, and land exists to be ruled. The Regent Black does not conquer for wealth — she conquers to restore hierarchy, with herself at its apex.
introduction.history: The fall of Monstru shattered the Crow Court, but it did not destroy it. Loyal servants followed the Queen into exile, carrying relics, rituals, and ancient knowledge of dominion. Coffin Canyon is not a refuge — it is a staging ground. Every battle fought here is another stone laid in the foundation of her returning empire.

core_values: Humans exist to be punished or die
what_they_fight_for: Exaltation of land into royal demesne
Restoration of the Crow Queen’s sovereignty
what_they_fight_against: Any rival claim to land or authority

reputation.allies_see_them_as: Cruel but inevitable rulers whose dominion brings terrible stability
reputation.the_canyon_sees_them_as: A crown returning, one consecrated stone at a time

faction_mechanics.signature_ability_description: The Crow Queen faction reshapes the battlefield through Consecrated Ground generated by the Regent Black and Demesne Markers. This ground suppresses morale failure, reinforces obedience, and accelerates faction momentum.
faction_mechanics.playstyle: Slow, oppressive territorial control. The Crow Queen begins restrained, then snowballs as Consecrated Ground spreads. They excel at morale pressure, objective denial, and late-game inevitability.
weaknesses: Punished heavily if the Regent Black falls

preferred_states.reason: The Regent Black’s ideal outcome—land fully bound to her will

neutral_states.reason: A stable stepping stone toward Exaltation

opposed_states.reason: Represents rejection of absolute rule and hierarchy
Uncontrolled monster autonomy threatens royal dominion

faction_features.name: Demesne Markers
faction_features.effect: Demesne Markers create Consecrated Ground in a 12" radius. Effects are identical to the Regent Black’s Sovereign Presence.

faction_features.name: The Realm Answers
faction_features.effect: Enemy units within Consecrated Ground cannot ignore Shaken for any reason.

units.name: The Regent Black
units.lore: The Crow Queen herself. Calm, composed, and utterly certain of her right to rule. Bow down, fleshy mortal.
units.tactics: Anchor the battlefield and protect at all costs. Her fall is catastrophic.

units.name: Ladies in Waiting

optional_upgrades.name: Sweet Cakes
optional_upgrades.effect: Once per game: Remove Shaken from an allied unit within 6"

units.lore: Silent attendants who carry banners, obelisks, comforts, and poison-laced sweets.

units.name: High Huntsman
units.lore: Master of the Queen’s hunts — manling or monster, it matters not.

units.name: The Jester
units.lore: A laughing Klowna horror bound by oath and hunger. The Queen finds him endlessly amusing, the rest of the Court hold their tongues.

units.name: Major Domo
units.lore: Banker, advisor, and keeper of the Queen’s ledgers.

units.name: Crown’s Champion
units.lore: The Queen’s shield and High Champion.

units.name: My Pet
units.lore: A collared creature that scurries ahead to claim what the Queen desires.

units.name: Dark Skald
units.lore: A many-fingered skald whose black lyre hums with ancient law. Each note is a command remembered by the land itself.
units.tactics: Morale control and consecration amplifier. Protect him and let the battlefield sing.
